result.execSummary:
The defendant Bryan J Konrad was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Total court costs and attorney's fees to be paid while on supervision. If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, in addition to all other enforcement sanctions available to the court, a civil judgment enforceable by all creditors' remedies shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.

Defendant to participate in drug and/or alcohol counseling and treatment deemed appropriate by DOC and to pay all costs of treatment.
Defendant to submit to random testing.
Defendant cannot possess or consume controlled substances or prescription medication w/out a valid prescription.
Defendant ordered to submit to DNA sample. 
Pay supervision fees.

State appears by Attorney Patti Wabitsch. Defendant Bryan Konrad in court with Attorney Michael Penkwitz. Plea questionnaire filed. Court examines defendant and gives voting restriction and firearm warning to defendant. Court accepts plea and finds defendant guilty. Court renders sentence.
State's
State's
Plea/sentencing hearing at 10-06-2015 03:00 pm

Defendant Bryan J Konrad in court with attorney Michael Girard Penkwitz.  Patti l Wabitsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary hearing waived.  Court finds probable cause and orders matter bound over for arraignment. Information filed.   Information read, defendant advised of penalties, further reading waived. Plea of not guilty entered.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 6, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
Status conference at 08-04-2015 01:15 pm

Attorney Michael Girard Penkwitz in court.  Adam Yale Gerol appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Counsel received copy of complaint, waives reading and enters a plea of not guilty.  Further discussion. Amended complaint filed making this file a felony.   Time limits waived for preliminary hearing on felony complaint.  Court orders adjournment, allowing time for defendant to decide whether preliminary hearing will be requested.
Defendant's
appointing Atty Penkwitz as court appt counsel
Atty Penkwitz accepts court appointment.
Further proceedings at 06-08-2015 08:30 am

Defendant Bryan J Konrad in court.  Adam Yale Gerol appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Def requested court appointed counsel, does not qualify for public defender. Court reviews affidavit of indigency form. Court will appoint counsel. Def to start repayment at $250   per mo starting 6/15/15  Further proceedings scheduled for June 8, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Scanned and forwarded to Branch 2 for review.

Defendant Bryan J Konrad in court.  Jeffrey A Sisley appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Does not qualify for public defender.   Court enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant.  Further proceedings scheduled for May 6, 2015 at 10:45 am.
Plea hearing on April 9, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Bryan J Konrad in court.  Jeffrey Alan Sisley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant requests adjournment to contact the public defender or court appointed counsel.  Plea hearing scheduled for April 9, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Conditions set by court:  Court orders absolute sobriety.  No possession/consumption of any intoxicants.  No use or possession of controlled substances unless valid prescription and in original containers.

Defendant Bryan J Konrad in court with attorney Rachel Marie Alme-Boaz.  Defendant in custody. Jeffrey A. Sisley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant appears by video conferencing from Ozaukee County Jail.  Public defender counsel appears with defendant as friend of the court, for purpose of bail hearing only at this time. Counsel/defendant waive reading of the complaint. State requests $500 signature bond with conditions.  Plea hearing scheduled for March 3, 2015 at 08:30 am.
